decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (OF/15/26/01, OF/15/26/02, OF/15/26/03, OF/15/26/08C, OF/15/26/09A, OF/15/26/10B, OF/15/26/11A, Design and Access Statement. Received: 13/07/2015. Unnumbered location plan. Received: 23/09/2015. OF/15/26/05C, OF/15/26/06D, OF/15/26/07D. Received: 18/01/2016. OF/15/26/04. Received: 03/02/2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - The premises shall be used for a nursery and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class  D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).
Condition : 5 - The use hereby permitted for nursery purposes shall not be carried on outside the following times 08:30 and 17:30.

Condition : 6 - The footpath hereby permitted between the site and Thamesvale Close shall not be operational outside the following times 08:00 and 18:30 and the gate to the site shall be locked outside those hours
Condition : 7 - No deliveries shall be taken at or despatched from the site outside the hours of 08:30 and 17:30 nor at any time on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, details of the provision to be made for both secure and covered cycle and buggy parking, including provision of hard surfaced access routes, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The cycle parking shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the buildings hereby permitted are occupied and shall thereafter be retained solely for its designated use.
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension, change of use to nursery of the pavilion, erection of a 1.8m high palisade fence and the creation of a pedestrian access onto Thamesvale Close.
